intro: Racosperma microcalyx, commonly known as the small-fruited acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow floral spikes. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds, typical of many legumes. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in shrublands and open woodlands. Racosperma microcalyx is valued for its ecological role in nitrogen fixation and as a source of nectar for pollinators.
